name: African Basil
notes: Leaves can be boiled for tea.

name: Ginger
notes: Fresh or powdered forms can be used. Avoid very high doses.

name: Scent Leaf
notes: Leaves can be used in soups or brewed as tea.

name: Bitter Leaf
notes: Boil before use. Usually taken as tea or soup.

name: Neem Bark
notes: Used as decoction. Avoid excessive intake.

name: Hausa Potato
notes: Roots used in decoctions.

name: Garlic
notes: Can be eaten raw, cooked, or in capsules.

name: Moringa
notes: Leaves can be eaten fresh or powdered. Avoid excessive consumption.

name: Tamarind
notes: Pulp used for juice or decoction.

name: Turmeric
notes: Root or powder can be added to meals or drinks.

name: Aloe Vera
notes: Gel applied to skin or mixed carefully with water.

name: Clove
notes: Can be chewed or boiled for tea.

name: Onion
notes: Can be eaten raw or added to tea.

name: Lemon Grass
notes: Boil leaves to make tea.

name: Black Seed
notes: Crushed and mixed with honey.

name: Mint
notes: Brew in hot water or chew fresh.

name: Fluted Pumpkin Leaves
notes: Used in soups or as juice.

name: Baobab
notes: Leaves or fruit used in soups or drinks.

name: Cashew Leaves
notes: Boil leaves for tea.

name: Bamboo Leaves
notes: Boil leaves and drink as tea.

name: Guava Leaves
notes: Boil for tea.

name: Pawpaw Leaves
notes: Boil and drink liquid.

name: Coconut Oil
notes: Can be applied to skin or consumed in small quantities.

name: Shea Butter
notes: Apply directly to skin.

name: Water Leaf
notes: Used in soups.

name: Senna Leaves
notes: Use with caution, acts as a laxative.

name: Alligator Pepper
notes: Chewed raw or added to preparations.

name: Fennel
notes: Brew into tea.

name: Hibiscus
notes: Used as drink or tea.

name: Camwood
notes: Used as paste or mixed with water.
